msItem.title: Alchemical tract
msItem.incipit: i recto ponita in materia medicinali subtili tracta de fuit corrupcionibus per virtutem boni
msItem.explicit: i recto donec ei poterit suprauenire certa entitas caolirs graduati

msItem.title: Prayer (draft)
msItem.incipit: i recto Supplicamus vos vt recipat nos ita vt sumus
msItem.note: Added by a later 15th-century hand, followed by pen-trials.

msItem.title: Medical recipe
msItem.incipit: ii recto [...] mediata sit vncia gummi Et bis [...] super addas octo lauarni
msItem.note: Full transcription; part of the page with the remainder of the text has been torn off.

msItem.title: Uninterpreted words
msItem.incipit: iv rectoseas sease

msItem.title: Proverb
msItem.incipit: vii verso Omnibus omnia non mea sompnia dicere possum Christus perpetue det nobis

msItem.title: De cognitione lapidis philosophici
msItem.author: Pseudo-John Dastin
msItem.incipit: 1r [C]vm gaudeant vti breuitate moderni verbum abreuiatum verissimus atque probatum
msItem.explicit: 14v Per hec enim; aperietur tibi sciencia huius regiminis certa: Quod nobis concedat si placet; qui sine fine regnat deus per omnia saecula saeculorum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: 14v Explicit liber secundus de cognicione lapidis Quem scripsit maiot monachus

msItem.title: Summa perfectionis [extract]
msItem.author: Pseudo-Geber
msItem.incipit: 15r [T]otam Nostram Scienciam quam ex libris antiquorum abbreuiauimus diuersa compilacione in nostris voluminibus
msItem.explicit: 17r quae naturalibus impotencijs corporis impeditur artifex in intencione sua

msItem.title: Tract on the virtues of the martagon lily
msItem.rubric: 17v De Virtute cuiusdam herbe que vocatur lunaria uel ma[rtogon]
msItem.incipit: 17v In nomine domini nostri Ihesu Christi Incipit Exorcismus ad haben[dum] et retinendum herbam que nominatur diuersis nominibus scilicet Archangel . Basilisca . Dragancia . Valeriana . Martogon . Sercolidon
msItem.explicit: 20r Natura eius est contra aquam fluere etcaetera
msItem.note: The text is accompanied by a circular astrological diagram on f. 19v.

msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.note: The first recipe is entitled: Copia cuiusdam experimenti sicut patet in libro Magistri Willelmi altoftes de atherston. Because M.R. James did not highlight this recipe and Anke Timmermann transcribed the author's name as Altastes, it has previously gone unnoticed that this recipe is attributed to William Altoftes [Altofte] (c.1487-1521)Altoftes [Altofte], William, c. 1487-1521 of Atherstone, Warwickshire, who was the principal surgeon to King Henry VII in 1487 [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), pp. 380-381]. His medical recipes can also be found in Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Ashmole 1389. Other recipes that are attributed to him feature on ff. 92r and 95v of this manuscript.

msItem.title: De quatuor gradibus medicinarum
msItem.rubric: 22r Quatuor sunt gradus herbarum sicut per regulam sequen[tem] patr[...]
msItem.incipit: 22r De gradibus herbarum alique sunt . Calide vel frigidie
msItem.explicit: 22r Destructo sensu nescit procedere quartus

msItem.title: A tract on making parchment
msItem.incipit: 22v Take a certeyn nomber off Skynnys off Caluis . and fyrst lay the[m] in fayre rennyng watyr a day or ij. and ich day turne the[m] onus or ij. tyll they blode be cleyne owte of them
msItem.explicit: 22v And then take a shavyng Iroin with with dult egge and skrapere hard on þe skynne on both sydis hard and fore so long þat þou mayst bryng owt no more water off þe skynne

msItem.title: Note
msItem.incipit: 23r Excessiuus et mortalis: qui destruit omnes sensus, et instrumenta et
msItem.note: Full transcription; added by a later 15th- or early 16th-century hand, left unfinished.

msItem.title: Testamentum
msItem.author: Pseudo-Raymond Lull
msItem.rubric: 23r Incipit practica Reymundi lully nacione Catholonic in suo testamento Et prima diffinicione quid est alkymia opera complete Anno domini 1332
msItem.incipit: 23r [A]lkymia est vna pars philosophie celata naturalis magis necessaria
msItem.explicit: 37v et intellige quod quelibet pars istius est rotunda intus et extra
msItem.finalRubric: 37v Cum dei laude explicit tractatus iste

msItem.title: Proverb
msItem.incipit: 38r Gaudia celorum det nobis factor eorum

msItem.title: Three alchemical recipes
msItem.incipit: 38r Sigillum; sit compositum cum farma subtilissima et albumine oui et ex papiro humido diligentissime carpinato Et hoc lutum sapiencie dicitur
msItem.explicit: 38r Alius modus ignis sine igne: Accipe vmdem [?] in tortulari expressam et fac per omnia sicut \de/ ventre aeger fecisti
msItem.note: The recipes are accompanied by drawings of two alchemical vessels, one of which contains writing in Latin and English: God sawe the kyng Amen.

msItem.title: Liber phoenicis
msItem.incipit: 39r Tractatus compositus super lapidem philoso- phorum per quendam philosophie discipulum et fuit missus Excellentissimo domino Regi Aragonum Artino Anno domino Millesimo 399
msItem.explicit: 45v metallica corpora antedicta et sic finis . laus deo
msItem.finalRubric: 45v Explicit cum adiutorio dei omnipotentis tractatus quidam de lapide philosophorum qui dicitur liber ffenicis

msItem.title: Prayer
msItem.incipit: 46r Ihesus Maria Wenefreda Modwenna

msItem.title: Tractatus de lapide philosophico [excerpt]
msItem.author: Pseudo-Thomas Aquinas
msItem.incipit: 46r Capitulum primum: Ecce supposita metallorum educitur a materia sua per planetas per naturam similiter et per artificium
msItem.explicit: 49r Et de mineralibus hec dicta sufficiunt

msItem.title: Humorous account about the priest Thomas Power
msItem.incipit: 49r Jocundum dictum vice graciarum ante prandium siue senam quod dom. Thomas Power presbiter quidam amenissimus semel iocose ante venerabilies dominos dicebat scilicet domino de Schrewsbury et domino Edwardo hastynges apud Darby et nominabat illud graciam Scottourm Benedict. Dominus. Ab omnibus aduenientibus et nichill secum apportantibus liberat nos omnipotens et misericors deus. Amen

msItem.title: Regula Philosophiae
msItem.rubric: 49v Sequitur Regule philosophie a me edite in quibus tota nostra sciencia continetur
msItem.incipit: 49v Prima regula est ista . Quod omne Sulphur cuiuscumque condicionis existit; Est causa corrupcionis tamen in natura quasi in arte
msItem.explicit: 49v quod extrema talium mediorum minus inperfectorum in primo latere; est Sulphur insufficiens

msItem.title: Liber lucis [excerpt]
msItem.author: Pseudo-John of Rupescissa
msItem.rubric: 51r De Rupe Scissa : Hic visionem Incredibile et vt videtur racioni Inpossibile et vt reperi scribere proposui . licet naturale non videatur esse verum
msItem.incipit: 51r Consideraui tribulaciones sacrosanncte Romane ecclesie
msItem.explicit: 55r Cui est honor fortitudo glorio et imperium per omnia saecula saeculorum Amen

msItem.title: Epistola accurtationis
msItem.author: Pseudo-Raymond Lull
msItem.rubric: 55v Incipit Epistola accurtacionis lapidis Benedicti Magistri Reymundi Lulij
msItem.incipit: 55v In virtute Sancte Trinitatis ipsiusque infinite Bonitatis
msItem.explicit: 59r Non puto alias accurtaciones esse quas in ista parua cedula declaraui. Elige ergo ex ea intentum laudamus deum . Et Benedictum sit nomine eius in eternum Amen

msItem.title: De consideratione quintae essentiae rerum omnium
msItem.author: John of Rupescissa
msItem.incipit: 60r Primus liber de consideracione quinte essencie
msItem.explicit: 90v uel in eius absencia ardens
msItem.finalRubric: 90v Explicit liber de consideracione quinte essencie omnium rerum Amen

msItem.title: Dietary
msItem.incipit: 91r Tu mihi mandasti dicto pro peste querelam
msItem.explicit: 92v Sic serues sanum te longo tempore totum

msItem.title: Poem on the healing virtues of herbs, stones, and words
msItem.incipit: 92v Virtus inest herbis . plus gemmis . maxima verbis / Sanctificant verba ; Sanant egrotus lapis et herba

msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.note: The collection includes two recipes associated with named medical practitioners: Anno gracie Mo ccccco xiiijo Thys is the Makyng off B[crossed out: l]alme artifical aftyr they weay of John Osburne - direcata composicio Thome maiot. A Magistro W. Altoft (f. 92r); Balme artificiall aftyr Magister Jacobe - John de la Towris and Magister Thomas Ive (f. 92v).

W. Altoft must be William Altoftes [Altofte] (c.1487-1521)Altoftes [Altofte], William, c. 1487-1521 of Atherstone, Warwickshire, who was the principal surgeon to King Henry VII in 1487 [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), pp. 380-381]. Other recipes that are attributed to him feature on ff. 21v and 95v. John de Towris may be John of Villula (d. 1122)Villula, John of, d. 1122, sometimes known as John of Tours, Bishop of Bath and physician [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), pp. 192-193]. There are no suggested identifications for the other named medical practitioners.

msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.note: The collection includes two recipes with attributions: Emplastrum ypericon secundum Johannem hart and a balsam secundum Magistrum Willelmum Altoft.(f. 95v).

John Hart may be John Hart (fl. c. 1517)Hart, John, fl. c. 1517, surgeon of London, who was a warden of the craft of surgery in the City of London in 1517 [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), p. 155]; or John Hert (c. 1488-1590)Hert, John, c. 1488-1590, surgeon of London, who was sworn as a warden of the Surgeons' Company of the City on 2 October 1488 [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), p. 156]; or John Hertte (c. 1475-1485)Hertte, John, c. 1475-1485, physician of London, who may be one and the same person as the aforementioned John Hert [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), p. 156]. William Altoft must be William Altoftes [Altofte] (c.1487-1521)Altoftes [Altofte], William, c. 1487-1521 of Atherstone, Warwickshire, who was the principal surgeon to King Henry VII in 1487 [see Talbot and Hammond (1965), pp. 380-381]. Other recipes that are attributed to him feature on ff. 21v and 92r of this manuscript.

msItem.title: Tract on the virtues of the oak
msItem.incipit: 94v In quercum sunt quatuor laudabilia
msItem.explicit: 95v Sed vt nesciatur ab hominibus illud benedicium folium vituperant coram hominibus et ipsum nullam virtutem habere dicunt ; mencientes etcaetera

msItem.title: Liber proprietarius
msItem.author: Pseudo-Raymond Lull
msItem.rubric: 96r In nomine Jhesu Incipit liber de Mercurijs seu de Elixerijs Mercuriorum
msItem.incipit: 96r [F]ili necesse est tibi vt intelligas operaciones per quas creantur nostra argenta vina
msItem.explicit: 127v In Anno post incarnacionem 1332 cum omnibus suis voluminibus que nominata fuerit in presenti testamento cum cantilena que sequitur in presenti Translatum fuit presens testamentum de ligna catalamica [sic] in latinam Anno domini 1443 sexto die Junij Apud london in prioratu sancti bartholomei

msItem.title: Cantilena
msItem.author: Pseudo-Raymond Lull
msItem.incipit: 128r Amor nos facit hoc rimare
msItem.explicit: 128v Sicut nos volumus breuiter liberale [?] philosophicaliter

msItem.title: Glossary
msItem.incipit: 128v A - Significat deum
msItem.explicit: 129r Z - liquor separacio seu tocius substancie corporis liquefacti

msItem.title: Letter of Thomas Fitzherbert, Professor of Canon Law, Vicar General, to Geoffrey Blythe, Bishop of Coventry and Lichfield, dated 13 February 1513
msItem.incipit: 130v Thomas ffytzerbert Decretorum doctor Reverendi patris et domini . Domini Galfridi permissione diuina et lich. Episcopi in remotis agentis vicarius in spiritualibus dilecto nobis in Christo
msItem.explicit: 130v Dat. lich sub sigillo nostri officij xiij die ffebruarij Anno domini 1513

msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.note: The recipes are entitled: De Marubio Ad Mollificandum v[...], and Aqua mirabilis petri hispani ad visum consziandum et clarificandum.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Folios i recto-131v: Hand with a six-petaled flower.

foliation.note: Numbering in brown ink in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos; except for folios i-vii and 41a whih were foliated in pencil by a modern hand.

list.item: Quire 912-1+2 (ff. 54-66: 12th leaf excised and 2 leaves added after the 11th leaf)
Quire 168+1 (ff. 111-119: one leaf added to the second half of the quire)
Quire 176-1 (ff. 120-124: one leaf missing in the second half of the quire)

p.formula: 18-1 (4th excised) 28 312 44 512 62 712 84 912-1+2 (12th excised, 2 added after 11th) 102 112 1214 1310 148 158 168+1 (one added to second half) 176-1 (one missing from second half) 182 196-1 (1st missing)

collation.p: Due to the irregularity of the quires and the absence of quire and leaf signatures, this first collation of the manuscript (previously not collated by M.R. James) is hypothetical and should be approached and followed with great care.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords written in brown ink in the right lower corners of versos do not always coincide with the start of new quires.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript features a large vertical tear in the lower margin of f. 129.

layout.seg: Ruled in hardpoint, frame only. Mainly single columns (except ff. 128r-129r which have two columns) 28-50 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: Copied by one or two hands writing in a cursive script with both secretary and anglicana features.

decoNote.p: Drawings of two alchemical flasks in dark ink on f. 38r; and two more in the outer margin and within the text on f. 63v.
Drawings of the lower half of an alchemical furnace on f. 49r.
Circular diagram with names of the planets and Signs of the Zodiac and astrological symbols in brown ink on f. 19v.
Drawings of geometric shapes in brown ink, representing alchemical symbols, within the text on on ff. 37r-37v; and a cross in the text on f. 78r.
Large initials in brown ink occasionally decorated with cadels.
Run-over symbols occasionally decorated as scrolls in brown ink (e.g. ff. 8r, 11v, 36r).

additions.note: Table of contents in a 17th-century hand. on f. i recto.

binding.p: 20th-century white half leather binding with blue paper sides and vellum-tipped corners over thin (?) wooden boards.

provenance.p: Benedictine abbey of Burton upon Trent, StaffordshireBurton Abbey: suggested by the prayer to St Modwenna on f. 46r, founder of Burton Abbey, and the letter to the abbot of Burton Abbey on f. 130v [see Ker (1941), p. 10; Ker (1964), p. 15; and 'Alchemica — Burton-upon-Trent, Staffordshire. Benedictine abbey of St Mary the Virgin and St Modwenna', in MLGB3].

William Symon [Symonds] (fl. 1540-1555) Symon [Symonds], William, fl. 1540-1555, Benedictine monk of Burton Abbey, Burton upon Trent, Staffordshire,: probably his name inscribed on f. vii verso: Wylliam Symon. Previously unidentified but almost certainly the Burton monk of that name who received a pension in 1540 and 1555 [see Francis Aidan Hibbert, The Dissolution of the Monasteries as Illustrated by the Suppression of the Religious Houses of Staffordshire (London: Pitman, 1910), p. 191].

?Recharda Bromley (fl. 1540-1555) ?Bromley, Recharda, fl. 1540-1555 , this female name may have been inscribed on f. ii recto: [R]echarda bromley. Due to damage to the page, the first name is now only partly legible.

history.provenance: One of the manuscripts of Thomas Gale (1635/6-1702) Gale, Thomas, 1672-1744, dean of York, antiquary and fellow of Trinity College Cambridge.
One of the manuscripts of Roger Gale (1672-1744) Gale, Roger, 1672-1744, antiquary and scholar, and son of Thomas Gale (1635/6-1702). Inherited from his father.
history.acquisition: Donated to Trinity College by Roger Gale (1672-1744) Gale, Roger, 1672-1744, son of Thomas Gale (1635/6-1702), in 1738. The alpha-numerical elements of the manuscript's current classmark (O, 8, 36) are printed separately on three labels pasted on the spine; its current classmark is written on the inside of the front cover and f. i recto together with the number 153 and old classmarks C.22. and O.1.4.22> [crossed out]; its printed ex libris featuring its armorial coat of arms and name (Collegium SS. et Individuae Trinitatis in Academica Cantabrigiensi) pasted on f. ii recto.

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry draws on M.R. James, The Western Manuscripts in the Library of Trinity College, Cambridge: A Descriptive Catalogue, 3 (1902); Linne R. Mooney, Manuscripts in the Library of Trinity College, Cambridge The Index of Middle English Prose, Handlist XI (Woodbridge: Brewer, 1995); and Anke Timmermann, 'Alchemy in Cambridge: An Annotated Catalogue of Alchemical Texts and Illustrations in Cambridge Repositories', Nuncius: Journal of the Material and Visual History of Science, 30:2 (2015), pp. 345-511.

availability.p: Visitors to Trinity College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Trinity College: Information for Readers.
